content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is the perfect level of difficulty for a Clash of Code IMO.

Couple of questions here about the test cases
- The problem allows for any ASCII character, but the tests only seem to use letters. Would it be possible to add more tests with numbers or symbols to make sure solutions are fully compatible?

- I also noticed the tests cover mostly square grids and wide grids (W > H). could we also add a test for a tall grid where H > W?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good, clear mini-puzzle, a bit on the longer side, but an interesting lists/indexing puzzle regardless.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I liked and enjoyed this clash: the instructions are clear and its funny to do.
Good job :)

General
* It's better to consistently use "character" instead of "pixel".

Goal
* Please format "H" and "W" as [[variables]].

* Please format "." as a {{constant}} instead of a [[variable]].

* Please mention that the row and column use 0-based indexing.

* Please delete "Tip:".

* Please change the last sentence to:

The "corrupted" image may have been incorrectly identified. If no character is missing, output {{Nothing Stolen}}.

Input
* Please revise the whole section as follows:

<<Line 1>>: Two space-separated integers [[H]] and [[W]] for the height and width of the image.
<<Next [[H]] lines>>: The original image. Each line contains [[W]] characters.
<<Next [[H]] lines>>: The corrupted image. Each line contains [[W]] characters.

Output
* Please revise the whole section as follows:

<<Line 1>>: The stolen character, the row and the column where it used to be, separated by a space. Or {{Nothing Stolen}} if no character is missing.

Constraints
* Please format "H" and "W" as [[variables]].

* Please change 100 to 10.

* Please mention that the original image does not contain any {{.}} characters.

Cases
* Each test and its corresponding validator should be similar.
  • Please change Validator 1 to be similar to Test 1.
  
  • Please change Test 4 to be similar to Validator 4.

Thanks.
Thank you for the feedback. I have updated the detail
Those scenarios could be taken into account, but I thought the task is already at an upper level of difficulty, so I have not added more scenarios

You can then replace ASCII characters with alphabetic characters in the description. Or add constraint on grid elements in Constraints section. Just to make sure everyone understands the problem the same way.
Thanks. Updated the ASCII characters with alphabetic characters in the description.

Goal
* Please add a closing bracket to the description of corrupted image.

* Please move "The row and column use 0-based indexing" to the end and add a full-stop.

Output
* Please revise the whole section as follows:

<<Line 1>>: The stolen character, the row and the column where it used to be, separated by a space. Or {{Nothing Stolen}} if no character is missing.

Thanks.
